intro: Alsophila stubelii, commonly known as the stubel's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in ideal conditions. Its fronds are typically dark green and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value. Alsophila stubelii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
